items.sentence: We should probably let Tom know what's happened.
What'll happen if Tom doesn't take his medicine?
Tom finally asked the question he wanted to ask.
Tom suggested we get together for a drink later.
I'll knock three dollars off the price per unit.
Tom says he wants to buy a house on Park Street.
Did you really give Tom a key to your apartment?
Tom usually eats fish two or three times a week.
Tom never stays anywhere longer than three days.
Tom pulled out a handkerchief and blew his nose.
Tom speaks with a slight French-Canadian accent.
Tom was accused of collaborating with the enemy.
Why are you so interested in what Tom was doing?
Tom had a bored, disinterested look on his face.
Tom never complains, even when things get tough.
Many people here consider Tom their best friend.
Tom doesn't get to his office until nine-thirty.
Tom looked around to see if anyone was watching.
Tom was wearing a suit and carrying a briefcase.
Tom didn't even bother looking up from his work.
